Name: Stela of Mut-hetepty
Description: The wooden stela is divided into three sections, each bordered by a triglyphic band. Underneath the lunette with winged sun disc is the usual adoration scene with accompanying inscriptions: the deceased is standing with the goddess Maat and praying in front of two offering tables and Re-Harakhty. On the reed mat spread out over the tables are several loaves and geese. Re-Harakhty is seated on a block throne, holding a was-sceptre in his left hand. Maat is standing behind the deceased, embracing him. Her head has been replaced by a feather on the upper part of a standard. Underneath are seven horizontal rows of hieroglyphs.
